meeting_annotations.transcript: Uh well I was going to say uh and again this is probably going to be a very broad comment but I think one of the major gaps that we have is is infrastructure, right? meeting_annotations.speaker: Paola Boggiatto
meeting_annotations.transcript: Uh people that would have to be doing all this work. Um so yeah, I think infrastructure is probably one of the biggest gaps that we're missing and I'll leave that open for discussion.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Becky Smith
meeting_annotations.transcript: I I was going to say that the problem my biggest problem that I run into is that surveillance follows the money. So surveillance is better done in areas that are well funded, that have high levels of people or especially lots of high income people that we we don't see surveillance in rural areas, we don't see surveillance in low income areas and we don't see surveillance in the small farms as much as we do in the big farms.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Becky Smith
meeting_annotations.transcript: Um and in the the less popular wildlife species compared to the more popular ones or more populous.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Bethany McGregor
meeting_annotations.transcript: Yeah, and I just want to echo that, you know, surveillance is following the money and I I'm going to give you a a vector born disease perspective on that.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Bethany McGregor
meeting_annotations.transcript: Um so in places where they have very well funded mosquito control organizations such as Florida, you have incredible surveillance networks for mosquito born diseases and just mosquito populations in general. meeting_annotations.speaker: Bethany McGregor
meeting_annotations.transcript: And so there are pockets here and there throughout the country.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Becky Smith
meeting_annotations.transcript: That's exactly where my perspective comes from because I have all the the Illinois mosquito surveillance data.

meeting_annotations.transcript: And Chicago is just covered in traps but not in low income neighborhoods.

meeting_annotations.transcript: And if you get outside of Chicago uh it's only in the cities really.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Sen Pei
